Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
I'm on this.   Setting up to put 1,000 KMD into the ICO.   

Good luck!    Your buyback model is fantastic.   

Do you think this could be adopted for other companies trying to raise funds that eventually want to become self managed and sustained?   

Let's say for example, I want to raise 10 Million in funds to invest in loans.  
As the loans payback, the buyback fund will increase through the interest earnings and investors can withdraw their original investments through the buyback fund allocation.    Hopefully to the point where the company holds all the original assets/funds.  

Is this the goal for Peer2?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: good to see you onboard @Mylo @FishyGuts

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content:
sure there are many models which can be built on this model. Buybacks seem to me a promising model if correctly applied. 

As always the model needs to be developed properly and I hope some countries will allow to do it. Because drawning innovation with high capital needs and bureaucracy is the same old way of limiting innovation only to the rich, and they always try to do so.in order to keep on that ''layer''

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: we hope to develop a legal frame with Inlea Foundation collaboration which could maybe also apply to other projects, so this is just the start

Content:

This is the biggest challenge for myself (United States).    I am appreciateive for your pioneering efforts.   Thank you for choosing KMD as your ecosystem for the project.

Content: I already have a "product" I would deploy in the US if you could make that dream a reality.

Content: probably we capped connections to unknown nodes to avoid problems until we add DPoW

Author: Seko#7408
Content: @kimmel (Pungo.io) that means exactly, that Pungo is a token on the Komodo chain?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: mmm not exactly we created an independent chain which will be later notarised using komodo DPoW

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: for now its an independent chain with 10 million coins, with block under demand (when there are tx on the mempool=aka queue, miners nodes generates a block automagically)

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: however there are no fees to send tx (its free) and miners get 0 fees to mine blocks

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: that means there is no economic reason to mantain the blockchain if you dont run a service supporting PGT. Thats why appart of having our nodes with the chain, when we add komodo DPoW we make sure that the 64 notary nodes of komodo will be mantaining our chain + it gets copied (backed) into Bitcoin blockchain through this notarization service, so it means it gets fully secured

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: clear enough @Seko ??

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Can you tell me more about the use-case? Which problem will solved Pungo?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: hey @Seko good you make this question, I wrote an article about this but still haven't published on medium.

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: You should consider that cryptocurrencies are new form of private money and value transfer

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: we are  building different products that bridge fiat and digital world: easy to use wallet, fiat gateway, card program, distributed fiat gateway...everything meets in  digital wallets (ours or 3rd party we dont actually mind)

Author: Seko#7408
Content: That sounds good...

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: we want to provide the infrastructure

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: what you asked is a very good question. Every company out there (big ones and small ones) have the ability to build a digital economy based on their products. To reward users, to create other business around their products, to build a community

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: however companies out there are still not aware of this or still dont understand it

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: they can create a whole economy around their business models that will make at the same time their business models grow

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: thats what some companies are starting to do. However blockchain is still in its infancy and those who want to go too fast wont succeed

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Ah ok, I understand. But cryptocurrencies very volatile at the moment. If I accept crypto as a seller, instead of Fiat, then I have the problem of volatility. Why shouldnâ€™t I take Fiat directly?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: for example a Shoe shop chain probably wouldnt succeed. But binance created a save-fees token and buyback program and see what happened

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: they created a full economy that benefited users and themselves

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: crypto has its own use cases. You know, casinos, trading online but also because crypto can be understood as a protocol by machines and fiat doesnt, thats why smart contracts are being born.

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: as you know there are also some pegged cryptocurrencies which are interesting if you dont want to expose yourself to volatility

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content:
Or why do you think most of the exchanges out there are now working with Pegged cryptos? its not legal tender, its more secure so computers can control it better. It's like dollar, but when you have dollar someone can freeze your account at any time. Pegged crypto doesnt has this problem.

Each crypto might have its use cases.

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: In our case ( regarding to your question) its quite clear. We create a FUND with REVENUE  from our business. So underlying "value" of PGT tends to grow.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Do you visualize this concept. For a better understanding graphics and videos would be helpful. Your designs are fantastic.

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: then we use PGT to pay commissions, affiliations, save fees...so PGT tends to grow in value and circulate. Nobody can say its worthless because we will always be able to calculate the exact value of each PGT (the amounts in the FUND). However market might give extra value if it thinks PGT is worth it

Author: Seko#7408
Content: And itâ€™s helpful for the community, of you write an article on Medium about the use-case.

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: Yes, will try thanks for the suggestion
